subject: Public Speaking
title: FDR's Day of Infamy
description: A 60-second lesson on FDR's Day of Infamy.

hook.text: On December 8, 1941, FDR asked Congress to declare war. His speech lasted just six and a half minutes.

buildup.text: His draft originally said 'a date which will live in world history.' He crossed it out and wrote 'infamy.'

discovery.text: That single word change made the sentence unforgettable. Infamy carried moral judgment that 'history' did not.

twist.text: The speech was deliberately short. FDR knew that after Pearl Harbor, Americans didn't need persuading â€” just direction.

climax.text: Congress declared war within an hour. The speech proved that brevity can carry more power than length.

punchline.text: One word made a speech immortal.

quiz.question: What word did FDR change from his original draft?
